---|---|---
FreeMarker|dco|0.0.9

cannot edit system files such as hosts file even with administrator previlage.
worked well in windows 7 but isn't working in 10.

1. win + R and enter drivers.
2. open etc -> hosts file with VS code and try to save it.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: VS Code cannot treat java file which contains large 'enum'.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 (32bit, 64bit both have problem with this)
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an empty java file.

2. Open it with notepad.exe and type this -> 3 times or more.
> public enum test {
AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, AAAAAAAAAAA, BBBBBBBBBB, CCCCCCCCCC, DDDDDDDDDD, EEEEEEEEEE, FFFFFFFFFF, 
}

3. Save the file, and open it with VS Code.

4. Observe. It'll take very long time to open and applying syntax highlight.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: $(basename).ts hiding JS files without associated TS files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (211ffdf184329179ddca9c1fe993f5f11f3c4dda, 2017-08-02T05:16:00.824Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.2
vscode-style-formatter|dwe|1.0.0
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-csproj|luc|0.7.0
vscode-scss|mrm|0.6.2
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-|0.0.23
vscode-subword-navigation|ow|1.1.5
ejs-language-support|Qas|0.0.1
Ruby|reb|0.12.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
cucumber|ste|0.9.6
quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.45
wallaby-vscode|Wal|1.0.56



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have the following piece of config inside my user settings:
```
    "files.exclude": {
        "**/.git": true,
        "**/.svn": true,
        "**/.hg": true,
        "**/.DS_Store": true,
        "**/*.js": {
            "when": "$(basename).ts"
        },
        "**/*.js.map": true,
        "build/**": true,
        "docs/**": true,
        "print/**": true
    },
```
2. For some reason, none of the JS files in the project are being suggested when I search for files (Ctrl + P). When I comment out the **/*.js rule, they start being suggested again.

Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

data.title: Search history item lost when it exists earlier in the history
data.body:
- Search for 'a'
- Search for 'b'
- Search for 'a'
- Search for 'c'
- Press alt+up

I expect to get 'a' because I searched that before 'c'. But I get 'b'. 'a' was not added because it was already in the history. I think it should be moved up to its latest location.

data.title: Race condition when displaying security message for blocked svgs in markdown preview
data.body:
**Bug**
Sometimes the security warning message does not show when an svg has been blocked in the markdown preview. There appears to be a race condition causing this. The content is still properly blocked

data.title: [css] Automatically show css value suggestions after completing property name

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
From https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45470541/visual-studio-code-html-suggestion-not-working/45470614


**Repo Steps**
In a css file:

```css
body {
   backgro|
}
```

Accept the suggestion for the `background-position` property name.

**Feature request**
After completing the property name, we should automatically show suggestions for the possible values. You currently have to start typing or trigger suggestions manually to see them.

data.title: OSX Force-Click support for Extensions
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.3

On Macs with newer touchpads, there is a 'Force Click' or 3D Click behavior that seems to only ever get used for dictionary lookup. Would be nice if support for this event was added and passed through to extensions so that people could do neat things most other IDEs don't currently support such as `goToDefinition` or something related.

PS: Apologies if this is the wrong place for feature requests.

data.title: NPE in WindowsShellHelper
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Open and kill terminal very quickly

This can likely happen when the terminal is killed during a wmic.exe call.

```
Cannot read property 'on' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property 'on' of null
    at new WindowsShellHelper (file:///C:/Users/Daniel/Documents/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/windowsShellHelper.js:26:24)
    at file:///C:/Users/Daniel/Documents/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/terminalInstance.js:98:90
    at Object.notifySuccess [as _notify] (file:///C:/Users/Daniel/Documents/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1170:59)
    at Object.enter (file:///C:/Users/Daniel/Documents/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:852:30)
    at Promise_ctor._run (file:///C:/Users/Daniel/Documents/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1068:29)
```

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (211ffdf184329179ddca9c1fe993f5f11f3c4dda, 2017-08-02T05:07:49.324Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Verifying #29660

Including `repos` when the folder opened in the workbench is `~/repos/test` will include `~/repos/test/some.css` if that is open in an editor, but not otherwise.

data.title: support "find usages" (like webstorm)
data.body:
If you right click a symbol in webstorm you can select "find usages". If the current symbol is a function, then "find usages" searches for all places where this function is called. If the current symbol is a variable, then "find usages" searches for all places where this variable is used etc etc.

This functionality is invaluable when refactoring and you want to know how many places I have to fix if I change the function signature etc.

I could not even find an extension that offers this functionality, even though I think it should be built-in to the language support just like "go to definition" etc.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- azuretoolsforvscode|bra|1.2.9 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 azure-iot-toolkit|for|0.1.3 azure-functions-tools|joh|0.3.0 vscode-devskim|MS-|0.1.4 mssql|ms-|1.1.0 azurecli|ms-|0.1.0 csharp|ms-|1.11.0 js-atom-grammar|ms-|0.1.13 PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1 typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-|0.0.23 vscode-azureextensionpack|ms-|0.0.4 team|ms-|1.121.1 azurerm-vscode-tools|msa|0.3.6 vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16 velocity|sod|0.1.0 usql-vscode-ext|usq|0.2.4 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create PowerShell script section starting with #region *string* and ending with #endregion 2. Put a comment inside the region 3. Fold script at #region *string* Result: vscode folds the region to the comment, and not to #endregion Screenshots for clarification: Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Add "Go to beginning/end of line" commands, maybe others
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: Windows 10

There are no commands associated for keys like `Home` and `End`. These might be useful considering #871 and for people without those keys. I'm one of the latter (my laptop doesn't have `End`).

data.title: Unable to Install Extensions behind Corporate Proxy/firewall
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open  VSCode
2. Click Extensions icon to the left
3. All the extensions' icons are missing (see attached picture)
4. When click "Install" of any extensions, it will flash installing but then back to Install button
5. No extensions can be installed
6. I am behind a corporate proxy/firewall, however I have setup http.proxy in custom settings and it seems to be working
![extensions](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17502718/28892009-79194d98-779a-11e7-9f16-aadb2e51c181.PNG)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No
